segments.source_content:
---
slug: /149
title: "This Week In React #149: Panda CSS, React-Native 0.72, Server Actions, Isograph, MDX, Remix, Gatsby, Storybook, OpenNext, Wrap-Balancer, Fresh, Docusaurus, surveys... "
authors: [slorber]
date: 06-20-2023
---

This week has been busier than last. In particular, there have been 2 great releases, one of them I was [eagerly waiting for](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1671433559280607235) to hit publish!

segments.source_content: Segun Adebayo (creator of Chakra UI) unveils his long-awaited CSS-in-JS library ([trailer](https://twitter.com/thesegunadebayo/status/1669732623994834946)). It offers very great DX, is based on modern CSS features (cascade layers), is performant (static analysis at build time, no runtime, atomic CSS)... In short, it ticks a lot of boxes and is generating a lot of interest. It integrates particularly well with React (JSX style props, React Server Components compatible, etc.), but can also be used with other frameworks.

translations.fr: Segun Adebayo (crÃ©ateur de Chakra UI) dÃ©voile sa bibliothÃ¨que CSS-in-JS tant attendue ([bande-annonce](https://twitter.com/thesegunadebayo/status/1669732623994834946)). Elle offre une excellente DX, s'appuie sur des fonctionnalitÃ©s CSS modernes (couches en cascade), est performante (analyse statique Ã  la compilation, pas de runtime, CSS atomique)... Bref, elle coche beaucoup de cases et suscite un vif intÃ©rÃªt. Elle s'intÃ¨gre particuliÃ¨rement bien avec React (props de style JSX, compatible avec les React Server Components, etc.), mais peut aussi Ãªtre utilisÃ©e avec d'autres frameworks.
translations.en: Segun Adebayo (crÃ©ateur de Chakra UI) dÃ©voile sa bibliothÃ¨que CSS-in-JS tant attendue ([bande-annonce](https://twitter.com/thesegunadebayo/status/1669732623994834946)). Elle offre une trÃ¨s bonne expÃ©rience dÃ©veloppeur (DX), est basÃ©e sur des fonctionnalitÃ©s CSS modernes (couches en cascade), est performante (analyse statique au moment de la construction, pas d'exÃ©cution, CSS atomique)... En bref, elle coche beaucoup de cases et gÃ©nÃ¨re beaucoup d'intÃ©rÃªt. Elle s'intÃ¨gre particuliÃ¨rement bien avec React (props de style JSX, compatible avec les React Server Components, etc.), mais peut Ã©galement Ãªtre utilisÃ©e avec d'autres frameworks.

segments.source_content: This is a library to keep a close eye on and one that could well compete with Tailwind: it integrates better with the target frameworks and doesn't force you to use a lengthy `className`.

translations.fr: C'est une bibliothÃ¨que Ã  surveiller de prÃ¨s qui pourrait bien rivaliser avec Tailwind : elle s'intÃ¨gre mieux avec les frameworks cibles et ne vous force pas Ã  utiliser un `className` interminable.
translations.en: C'est une bibliothÃ¨que Ã  surveiller de prÃ¨s et qui pourrait bien rivaliser avec Tailwind : elle s'intÃ¨gre mieux avec les frameworks cibles et ne vous force pas Ã  utiliser un `className` interminable.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘€ [State of React - Survey Preview](https://github.com/Devographics/surveys/issues/85#issuecomment-1586439053): design of the new React survey is almost complete. You can have a [preview](https://survey.devographics.com/en-US/survey/state-of-react/2023) and give feedback.
- ğŸ‘€ [Lee Robinson - "Dev server performance is our top priority"](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1671260151347830784): Next.js' dev server app dir has been criticised for its slowness, but Vercel plans to remedy this.
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix - Dev Server v2 is now stable](https://twitter.com/pcattori/status/1669828506044203008): can be activated in v1 with a flag.
- ğŸ‘€ [MDX - new GitHub syntax highlighting](https://twitter.com/wooorm/status/1671159366085672968)
- ğŸ‘€ [MDX - new playground options](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1669332176431894533)
- ğŸ“Š [Stack Overflow Developer Survey 2023](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2023/): as expected, React remains the most widely used web framework this year and Next.js has moved up the rankings.
- ğŸ’¬ [Gatsby RFC - Adapters](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/discussions/38231): a new type of plugin to adapt the build to a deployment platform (Vercel, Netlify...) regarding caching, headers, redirects...
- ğŸ“– [Improved Next.js image docs](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1670815761508581376)
- ğŸ“œ [Introduction to Next.js Server Actions](https://makerkit.dev/blog/tutorials/nextjs-server-actions): great overview of Server Actions in Next.js 13.4. TIL that they can be invoked from a button.
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing Isograph](https://isograph.substack.com/p/introducing-isograph): Robert Balicki (ex Relay) shares the POC of a new GraphQL client for React based on the concept of resolvers.
- ğŸ“œ [SpiderMonkey Newsletter - Firefox 114-115](https://spidermonkey.dev/blog/2023/06/09/newsletter-firefox-114-115.html): Firefox devs announced that they are working on optimisations for frameworks such as React. With Firefox 115, [all browsers now support Change Array By Copy](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1671166785738133505), a new ES2023 feature super useful to update your React state.
- ğŸ“œ [React Admin June 2023 Update](https://marmelab.com/blog/2023/06/13/react-admin-june-2023-update.html): presents a fine list of features introduced over the last 3 months.
- ğŸ“œ [Ryan Bigg - Rails 7, React, TypeScript, ESBuild and View Components](https://ryanbigg.com/2023/06/rails-7-react-typescript-setup): explain how to manually integrate React into a Rails app. SPA mode, or with several entry points.
- ğŸ“œ [Replay for Test Suites](https://blog.replay.io/replay-for-test-suites): the time-travel debugging tool integrates with Cypress and raises $13m.
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook - New API references, TypeScript code snippets, and docs DX](https://storybook.js.org/blog/docs-updates/)
- ğŸ“œ [A Visual Guide to Layouts in Next.js 13](https://www.builder.io/blog/layouts-in-nextjs-13-visual)
- ğŸ“œ [Building a `<Button>` in React](https://catjam.fi/articles/ultimate-button-component)
- ğŸ“œ [Test your React hooks with Vitest efficiently](https://mayashavin.com/articles/test-react-hooks-with-vitest)
- ğŸ“œ [Add Prisma to a Remix app](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-prisma)
- ğŸ“¦ [Docusaurus v3 alpha - MDX 2 + React 18](https://twitter.com/docusaurus/status/1669370649326895105)
- ğŸ“¦ [Vercel AI SDK](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-the-vercel-ai-sdk)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Wrap Balancer v1.0 - now uses the native CSS feature](https://twitter.com/shuding_/status/1669602326481387522)
- ğŸ“¦ [OpenNext 2.0 - revamped ISR support](https://twitter.com/fanjiewang/status/1670941900302368768)
- ğŸ“¦ [Fresh 1.2 â€“ welcoming a full-time maintainer, sharing state between islands...](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-1.2)
- ğŸ“¦ [Melange 1.0 - compiles OCaml / Reason to JavaScript](https://buttondown.email/anmonteiro/archive/melange-hits-v10/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Waku 0.12](https://twitter.com/dai_shi/status/1670650381762961408)
- ğŸ¥ [Are React client components bad?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6jM_0wDOw4g)
- ğŸ¥ [React Summit 2023 - Youtube Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNBNS7NRGKME880lcYdw9QwkCiDYQFgCK)

segments.source_content: **[React Native 0.72 - Symlink Support, Better Errors, and more](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/0.72-metro-package-exports-symlinks)**

translations.fr: **[React Native 0.72 - Prise en charge des liens symboliques, de meilleures erreurs et plus](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/0.72-metro-package-exports-symlinks)**
translations.en: **[React Native 0.72 - Prise en charge des liens symboliques, meilleures erreurs et plus encore](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/0.72-metro-package-exports-symlinks)**

segments.source_content: After several Golden RCs, the latest version of React-Native has finally been released and will shortly be used in the Expo 49 SDK. There are quite a few improvements mentioned (DX, Hermes, performance...) and some breaking changes. I particularly like these 2 new features in the Metro bundler:

translations.fr: AprÃ¨s plusieurs Golden RC, la derniÃ¨re version de React-Native est enfin sortie et sera bientÃ´t utilisÃ©e dans le SDK Expo 49. Plusieurs amÃ©liorations sont mentionnÃ©es (DX, Hermes, performance...) ainsi que des changements cassants. J'apprÃ©cie particuliÃ¨rement ces 2 nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s dans le bundler Metro :
translations.en: AprÃ¨s plusieurs Golden RCs, la derniÃ¨re version de React-Native a finalement Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©e et sera bientÃ´t utilisÃ©e dans le SDK Expo 49. Plusieurs amÃ©liorations sont mentionnÃ©es (DX, Hermes, performance...) ainsi que des changements cassants. J'apprÃ©cie particuliÃ¨rement ces 2 nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s dans le bundler Metro :

segments.source_content:
- Symlinks (beta): long-awaited feature to simplify monorepo and pnpm support
- [Package Exports](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/package-exports-support) (beta): better encapsulation of libs, compatibility with the rest of the frontend ecosystem and ability to expose a specific React-Native entry point.

translations.fr:
- Liens symboliques (bÃªta) : fonctionnalitÃ© longtemps attendue pour simplifier la prise en charge des monorepos et de pnpm
- [Package Exports](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/package-exports-support) (bÃªta) : meilleure encapsulation des bibliothÃ¨ques, compatibilitÃ© avec le reste de l'Ã©cosystÃ¨me frontend et capacitÃ© Ã  exposer un point d'entrÃ©e React-Native spÃ©cifique.
translations.en:
- Liens symboliques (bÃªta) : fonctionnalitÃ© attendue depuis longtemps pour simplifier la prise en charge des monorepos et de pnpm
- [Package Exports](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/06/21/package-exports-support) (bÃªta) : meilleure encapsulation des librairies, compatibilitÃ© avec le reste de l'Ã©cosystÃ¨me frontend et capacitÃ© Ã  exposer un point d'entrÃ©e React-Native spÃ©cifique.

segments.source_content: Passionfroot's mission is to empower the independent businesses of tomorrow via YouTube, Podcasts, Social Media, and Newsletters. Join us in building a tool that will empower creators globally to build scalable, sustainable businesses.

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

translations.fr: Vous souhaitez travailler sur les applications les plus utilisÃ©es au monde ? Aimeriez-vous co-crÃ©er la technologie React Native ? Rejoignez l'Ã©quipe Callstack de leaders React & React Native. Consultez notre site pour plus de dÃ©tails. Nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience - montrez-nous ce que vous savez faire !

Rejoignez l'Ã©quipe Callstack, leader en React et React Native. Consultez notre site pour plus de dÃ©tails. Nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience - montrez-nous ce que vous savez faire !

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

translations.fr: Nous avons plusieurs postes ouverts pour des dÃ©veloppeurs spÃ©cialisÃ©s en React Native ! La rÃ©munÃ©ration est d'environ 160k plus 10% de bonus. Vous devez avoir une expÃ©rience en production avec RN et Ãªtre basÃ© aux Ã‰tats-Unis. Envoyez un DM Ã  [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) pour en savoir plus et n'oubliez pas de mentionner This Week in React.
translations.en: Nous avons plusieurs postes ouverts pour des dÃ©veloppeurs spÃ©cialisÃ©s en React Native ! RÃ©munÃ©ration : ~160k plus 10% de bonus. ExpÃ©rience en production avec RN et rÃ©sidence aux Ã‰tats-Unis requises. Contactez [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) par DM pour en savoir plus et mentionnez This Week in React.
